Message.Title: BEAR TRAP has been set!!!!!
Message.Msg: Lackluster 3Q is all smoke. Back out $1B in revenue lost due to strong dollar, and big software and service contracts signing in the first week of October leaves me believing the trap has been set. Expect a blowout 4Q with executive incentives to drive revenue with trailing carryover from 3Q. Let it rest in the upper 190s to 200 range till mid November then jump in, or jump in now. Push to $215 to $220 by year's end. Easy 10% short term gain. Think like the big guys.
Well said. I'm waiting for 195.

My guess is that the fiscal cliff has delayed some of IBM's deals. Too many comparisons now of IBM's p/e compared to MSFT's lower p/e and faster growth rate.

Topic.Title: IBM will fall further to 190 level

Message.Msg: Market has clearly peaked, its the best time to short stocks.

Message.Title: Do You Trust CFO?
Message.Msg: IBM CFO, Marl Loughridge, claims the final month of last quarter (September) the firm saw a huge slowdown in business, and some contracts will be pushed back to this quarter. These were significant contracts that would have given IBM the revenue to meet Wall Street expectations, and add to their earnings per share. It may seem logical the US elections (growth down 4% in North America) is a plausible excuse for these contract delays. Also, with the fiscal cliff looming it may have cause for some to be cautious with IT spending. IBM was a stock that value investors could count on, and now we must rely on the words of the CFO. That is a paradigm shift for IBM, and value investors will seek other options in the markets to park their money. It has been my experience that when these types of shifts occur it is best to just wait and watch, and typically these guys are not to be trusted. IBM is a dead stock until the next EPS report when the CFO will have some explaining to do. Either the contracts come through, and there is huge beat on the top and bottom lines. Or, IBM market share is eroding and we will see some layoffs worldwide. There is far too much uncertainty now in IBM and the media is ready to jump on the bear bandwagon. There is nothing positive to propel this stock, and it is likely to drift downwards, or settle at a lower price, for the rest of the year. Do you trust the CFO? It looks like most investors do not! At least, they do not want to wait around for an answer.
Smart move! You can always buy them back...
I am holding! Always have...

Topic.Title: Huge Fiscal Stimulus... MASSIVE monetary Stimulus... NO Growth.

Message.Msg: ... the amount of stimulus Obama has working in his favor right now is massively historic in magnitude... yet the 1.3% growth in our economy (GDP) is slower than last year... ... and last year was slower than the year before THAT. It's like swimming downstream and not making any headway... it's absolutely NAUSEATING! 4 more years like the last 4, and we're going down HARD in this country.
